poem:
"Remnants of Singularity"

In All Down Darkness Wide, a self spills,
Revealed in ink's discreet release.
The prose of one mapped out in tongue-tipped fires,
A revelation hidden in each crease.

A homage due, from bleak despair we rise,
Through memoirs whispered strong on page.
Even briefest words give birth to skies,
The self's eternal hide and seek our stage.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rapture’s Road by Seán Hewitt review – a hide and seek of the self Seán Hewitt made his name with an arresting debut collection, Tongues of Fire, and an unforgettable memoir, All Down Darkness Wide, an account of his life as a young gay man and a moving exploration of his relationship with a depressed partner, a book that doubled as a homage to Gerard Manley Hopkins. In the memoir, he described himself, at one". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
